speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you listening to the radio?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No radio either.  Matter fact, the radio -- I didn't have a radio in my truck. Somebody broke in it and took the radio out.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How fast were you going?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: I'll estimate about, when I made the turn, I was doing less than 15 miles an hour.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You were going less than 15 miles an hour?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: When I made the turn, yes, sir.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's 15?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: I said less than 15.  Somewhere between 12 and 15 miles an hour, I would say.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What part of your vehicle came into contact with my client's vehicle?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: You said what part of my vehicle?  Say that again.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What part of your vehicle came into contact with my client's vehicle, the other vehicle involved in the accident?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: The backside of the truck, the bed area behind the door.  I have a two-door truck.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What part of her vehicle was impacted?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: The front bumper, that area.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever get your truck repaired?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No.  It was 24 years old.  I ain't going to repair that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you wearing glasses at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Yes, sir.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you look in your rear-view mirror before this accident?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Say that again.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you look in your rear-view mirror before the accident happened?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No, I looked ahead.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Before you took the left turn there, did you look in front of you to make sure no cars were coming?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: I saw no nothing.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You think her car came out of nowhere?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Like I said, it was dark, and I didn't see it.  I didn't see no headlights.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you think it fell from the sky?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Objection. Don't answer that.
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: Which direction was my client heading?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: South.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Which direction were you heading?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: North.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How far down Broad Street were you able to see in front of you?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: You can see three four, blocks, more than likely, if you got lights on or something like that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you come to a complete stop before making the left-hand turn?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You didn't?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: I didn't come to a complete stop.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where do you think her car came from?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Objection. You don't have to answer that.
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: I didn't see no headlights.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You don't know?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No, I don't know where they came from really.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was there anything blocking your view at all?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Describe the damage to your vehicle.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: The bed area, my truck bed, right quarter panel and all that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it dented?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Yeah, my truck had fenders called a flareside.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know of any witnesses to this accident?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No, wasn't nobody out there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you review any documents in preparation for this deposition?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Repeat that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you review any documents in preparation for this deposition?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No, sir.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: You said did I review any documents?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yeah.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Only thing we looked at was where the accident happened at on the computer.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The Google map.
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: You looked at a Google map?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: I just looked at it on the computer.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Not a paper, on the computer.  That's what he's trying to clarify for you.
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: Did your vehicle leave any skid marks on the road?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How about the other car, did that leave any skid marks?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Like I said, I didn't look and see if it made any skid marks.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How far did your vehicle push that white Explorer after the accident happened?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Objection. Don't answer that. His car didn't push anything. She pushed him.  She hit him.  You know it. I know it.  Knock it off.
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: Now, after this accident happened, how did the white Explorer react?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Repeat that again.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: After this accident happened, how did the white Explorer react?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: It just was sitting there.  I guess they turned the engine off.  That was it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How did your vehicle react?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: My engine was still running.  I just turned it off.  Then the police came.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was your vehicle pushed in any direction at all?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No, because I already made the turn, and I was about, I guess, about 20, 25 feet from where they hit me at where I stopped, maybe 25, 30 feet.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have a CDL?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Yes, sir.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that still active?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Yes, sir.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm going to show you the police report that was generated in relation to the accident.  I'm going to mark this as Hunter-1. Have you ever seen this document before?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now, this little box with an arrow on the end is supposed to represent your vehicle.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Number 2.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you agree with that, Ms. Frascella?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Do I agree with what?
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: Number 2 is supposed to represent --
speaker: MR. DALY

text: I agree that his vehicle is identified as vehicle 2 on the police report.
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: Do you disagree with the positioning of the vehicle --
speaker: MR. DALY

text: I was in this lane when it hit me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: This is the northbound lane here.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Northbound lane, yeah.  This is southbound lane, right?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yeah.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: There is two lanes, you know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Right.  It doesn't look designated.  There's dots here, but up here they didn't put the dots.
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: I think when I hit that vehicle there I was in this lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You think she was in the northbound lane heading south?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No, no, no.  It was on the inside southbound lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm going to take this back from you, all right?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: That lane there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm going to clear this up for you. This is supposed to represent the northbound lane, okay?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: That's the northbound lane there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's all northbound.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Okay.  Well, they were in this lane here.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: There is two lanes coming southbound. Was she in the right lane or the left lane of southbound traffic?
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: The inside lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: To you, is the inside lane the left lane or the right lane? Is the inside closer to the yellow line or closer to the shoulder?
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: The outside lane is the shoulder.  The inside lane is where the line is at.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So she's in the inside lane?
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: Inside lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Let's say this is the inside lane. This is the line that separates the two lanes going southbound, okay?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Uh-huh.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now, do you disagree with how the police officers drew up this accident?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Which lane is this in?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: What lane would that be in right there?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The inside lane of the southbound.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: The inside lane?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Okay, yeah.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You agree with the characterization of the accident per the police report diagram?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: My truck was further here than when I got hit.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Further which way?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: This way.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Closer to Old York Street?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How much further?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: I really can't say that.  It was here, this lane here.  I had twisted in this lane right here when I got hit.  You got a pen? I'll show you.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yeah.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: I was in this lane here.  My door was hit around this area here.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I don't know what you're saying, but I want you to mark on this number 2 where the point of impact was.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: (Witness complies with request.) Right here.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: He wants to know where your vehicle was, not where the cars hit.
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: I want to know where the car was hit.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: You want to know where the car was at? I was here in here.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Just for the record, he's indicating his car was farther up on Conlyn Street than indicated on the police report.
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: Now, was your vehicle on Broad Street or Conlyn Street when the accident happened?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: One part was on Conlyn Street and one part was on Broad Street, if you want to call that Conlyn Street.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yeah, I do. You hadn't completed your turn yet at that point?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: Say again.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You didn't complete your turn yet at that point?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: I turned because they hit me behind my door.  I got a two-door truck.  They hit me behind my door.  My passenger side door and my fender.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I don't have any other questions. Anything you want to put on the record?
speaker: MR. DALY

text: No.
speaker: MS. FRASCELLA

text: Thanks, Mr. Hunter.
speaker: MR. DALY

text: (Whereupon, the deposition concluded at 2:48 p.m.)
